file_content.text: It's about time the Republic made some progress around here.
I managed to retrieve all of the data recorders.
I did it.
Perfect timing, too--Anlen just finished dressing my wounds. Not too shabby, Private.
Oh... thank you, sir.
Once that intel gets analyzed, the fleet will finally start making some headway on this planet.
You weren't kidding about those scavengers.
I see why you needed me.
Persistent buggers, weren't they? Serves them right.
Happy to help.
No problem.
That's what I like to hear. Junior could learn from you.
I'll transmit this data back to base. We should be able to step up our offensive any day now.
Keep your wits about you, and you'll be fine.
Okay, this time we'll sneak in through the--ow! Treat the wound, don't poke at it like an impatient Jawa!
Sorry, sir. We've got company.
Oh. Hello there, I'm Sergeant Carness. This here's Private Anlen. We're trying to recover some Imperial intel, preferably without getting shot... again.
What sort of information are you after?
What kind of intel?
Are you okay?
I took a couple grazes, and I think poor Anlen may have singed both his whiskers.
If it's so dangerous, why did the Republic send scouts?
It's just you two?
This was supposed to be a simple grab-and-go mission.
Command sent us to retrieve data recorders from crashed Imperial starships. They contain valuable intel on the Empire's planetary defenses.
Unfortunately, the area is crawling with scavengers--Imperial deserters, Balmorran outlaws, even combat droids. Nearly killed us... twice. This is our third attempt.
This is insane, sir. Why should we keep risking our necks when we have a Jedi right here?
This is insane, sir. Why should we keep risking our necks when we have a war hero right here?
This is insane, sir. Why should we keep risking our necks when we have a hotshot spacer who can do it?
This is insane, sir. Why should we keep risking our necks when we have someone right here who can do it?
This is insane, sir. Why should we keep risking our necks when we have a perfectly capable group right here?
You seem to think these recorders are worth dying for.
This stuff is important?
It could be the works: Imperial fleet positioning, clearance codes, battery placement... maybe Anlen's right.
I can get those data recorders for you.
Let me do it.
A servant of the Republic doesn't shirk responsibility.
Remember your duty.
The Republic needs to stand on its own two feet, Private.
Jedi can't fight every battle.
You're a soldier of the Republic, Private. Show a little backbone.
Shape up, soldier.
I've seen Gamorreans that aren't as green as this kid.
Easy there, rookie.
I can't say I completely disagree with Anlen. Those scavengers are packing some serious firepower. Still....
That information could help the Republic fleet establish a solid foothold on Balmorra, bring us one step closer to liberating the planet.
I'm not leaving here without those recorders, but we simply aren't equipped to get past those lunatics. Can... you get them?
You two rest here. I'll handle this.
Leave it to me.
This won't be the first time I've picked up someone else's slack.
I'll clean up your mess.
I hate to have someone else fight my battles for me. I appreciate this.
Not my problem. [Refuse quest]
I see. Well, third time's the charm... I hope.
Those scavengers are out of their minds.
The data recorders should be near the shipwrecks. The scavengers had sniper support, so keep your head down and your eyes peeled.
